title: Report Your Nexus Blitz Bugs Here!
body:
# Welcome to the Nexus Blitz Bug Report Megathread. 

What this means is that we'll **not** be collecting general gamemode feedback here- only bug reports!

When reporting bugs, provide as much information as possible- this would include reproduction steps, events leading up to the bug, and a detailed description of the bug itself.

Example Report:
> * **Description:** Describe the bug that occurred
* **Visuals:** Video or screenshot of the bug
* **Steps to reproduce:** How can this bug be replicated?
* **Expected Result:** What was the expected outcome?
* **Observed Result:** What was the actual outcome?
* **Reproduction Rate:** How consistently can it be replicated?
* **System Specs:** OS, graphics unit, CPU, etc.


Cheers, and Happy Snowdown!

Two bugs that I ran into while playing. 

The first: When prize fight began, an allied amumu has his W toggled on while outside of the fight, he was unable to untoggle it until his fight began, leaving him with low mana before he even started.

Observed result: Amumu starting a prize fight with ~100 mana out of his 400-500.
Reproduction right: I would assume 100% of the time if you leave W on as a prize fight begins, but I'm uncertain of that. 

The second one: After an allied irelia won a prize fight, she was not warped to the outside of the fight, but remained in the spot that she ended the fight in. 
Expected result: Irelia warps back to the sidelines, with the rest of the team
Observed result: Irelia was invincible/invulnerable/untargetable in the middle of the prize fight area.
Reproduction rate: Unknown, since I'm not entirely sure how it happened.

Description: Ezreals W (Essence Flux) Does not affect major NPC Objectives. IE (Teemo, Veigar, Scuttle Racer, Nexus Blitz) while playing Nexus Blitz.

This occurs every time, without fail, regardless of whether or not enemy Champions or Turrets are around. Ezreals Q (Mystic Shot), E (Arcane Shift) and R (Trueshot Barrage) are still capable of affecting NPC Objectives.

Ezreals W Is a big part of his damage output, especially on his AP builds. Not being able to target NPC Objectives with his W greatly affects his ability to compete for Objectives, arguably the biggest part of Nexus Blitz.

**Description:** URF Deathmatch awards two (2) team bonuses to the winning team if the last survivors kill each other at the same time. The game declares both teams the winners, then awards two buffs to the team that got the kill first.

**Video:** https://gfycat.com/happygoluckysmoggyclam
 
**Steps to Reproduce:** In URF Deathmatch, have two players kill each other at or near the same time.

**Expected Result:** The team who scored the last kill first should win and be awarded one team buff.

**Observed Result:** The game declares both teams the winner and awards _two_ team buffs to the team that actually won.

**Reproduction Rate:** Probably 100%, albeit it requires an unlikely scenario.

**System Specs:** Win 10, Intel i7-4710HQ, GTX 970M, 16GB RAM
